title: What is the partial derivative of f (x,y, z) =x^2y+6z^3xy? - Quora

response.answer_text: Actually in question it is not mentioned that the partial derivatives with respect to whom . The given function is f(x,y,z)=x2y+6z3xyf(x,y,z)=x2y+6z3xy ∂f(x,y,z)∂x=fx=2xy+6z3y∂f(x,y,z)∂x=fx=2xy+6z3y ∂f(x,y,z)∂y=fy=x2+6z3x∂f(x,y,z)∂y=fy=x2+6z3x ∂f(x,y,z)∂z=fz=18z2xy∂f(x,y,z)∂z=fz=18z2xy And the exact Differential of the function can be written as df=∂f(x,y,z)∂xdxdf=∂f(x,y,z)∂xdx +∂f(x,y,z)∂ydy+∂f(x,y,z)∂zdz+∂f(x,y,z)∂ydy+∂f(x,y,z)∂zdz =(2xy+6z3y)dx+(x2+6z3x)dy+(18z2xy)dz=(2xy+6z3y)dx+(x2+6z3x)dy+(18z2xy)dz Hope this helps Thanks
